clcommon__Disclosure_Definition__c.Name: RequestForgivenessDisclosure
clcommon__Disclosure_Definition__c.clcommon__Description__c: In order to qualify for full loan forgiveness, you must meet the loan forgiveness qualifications outlined by the Small Business Administration. Any reduction in employment, reduction in salaries or misuse of funds may result in a reduced forgiveness or may disqualify you from loan forgiveness. You will receive a Borrower Certification, in which you will certify to appropriate and permissible use of your SBA Paycheck Protection loan. You must sign this document in order to qualify for loan forgiveness.

clcommon__Static_Content__c.Name: usageHelpText
clcommon__Static_Content__c.clcommon__Content__c:
Why do we need this Data?
In order to have your loan forgiven, you must :
  • Use 75% or more of the proceeds on Payroll Costs, and
  • Use up to 25% of the proceeds on other permissible uses(such as Rent, Utilities, Group Benefits and Mortgage Interest)

We use this documentation to verify permissible use of the funds you have received on your Payment Protection Program loan.

Why do we need these Documents?
In order to have your loan forgiven, you must :
  • Use 75% or more of the proceeds on Payroll Cost, and
  • Use upto 25% of the proceeds on other permissible uses(such as Rent, Utilities, Group Benifits and Mortgage Interests)

We use this documentation to verify permissible use of the funds you have received on your Payment Protection Program loan.
